/hc/articles/231283788-What-is-pixiv:
What is pixiv?

Pixiv is a community that makes it easy for illustrators and illustration enthusiasts to communicate with each other through their content, and which allows users to post their own illustrations.

The illustrations that you post and bookmark form your profile, and users communicate with each other, with the content of their profiles at the center of their discussions.

Illustrations with large variety of genres are uploaded to pixiv. The community is also frequently used to hold both user-organized contests and the official contests of manufacturers as well. The community is also used as a co-creation platform, where users collaborate with each other and new content is born.

Registering with pixiv is free. It’s also free to use.

/hc/articles/235645707-About-pixiv-verif:
About pixiv verified accounts

Accounts belonging to corporations, organizations, and individuals whose identities were confirmed by pixiv Inc., which operates pixiv (www.pixiv.net), and accounts operated by pixiv's staff are considered "pixiv verified accounts".
On pixiv verified accounts, a verified badge  appears next to the account's name on the profile page (it won't be displayed on the profile picture).

pixiv does not guarantee the identity of any account that claims to belong to a specific corporation or organization, other than the verified ones.
We shall not take any responsibility for any trouble that may occur, so please be careful of spoofing and act at your own risk.

* Specifications and Terms of Use of pixiv verified accounts differ from those of regular accounts.

■ Desktop and mobile version

You can download the latest versions of the recommended browsers from Windows 7 or later (for Windows) and from OS X 10.9 Mavericks or later (for Mac).

  • Google Chrome
  • Firefox
  • Safari for macOS/iOS
  • Microsoft Edge

■ Official app
The app is compatible with iOS and Android and can be downloaded from the following links.
For the OS versions supported by the official app, please refer to each download page.

  • iPhone app
  • Android app

* Operations are not guaranteed for game devices, the Android standard browser, or other browsers/apps not mentioned above.
* pixiv is not available on feature phones.

/hc/articles/7026475470105-If-you-encoun:
If you encounter an issue...

Common issues:

  • The layout of the website is broken
  • Pages do not display properly
  • You are unable to log in
  • You are unable to post
  • Long loading times

If you experience any of the issues listed above while using pixiv, please check the following first.

1. Check the recommended environment.
　For more information, refer to "What is the recommended environment for pixiv?"

2. Check if there's a problem with your device.
    Make sure that your device has sufficient processing capacity.

　  ＜If you are using the desktop version of pixiv...＞

  • Restart your browser.
  • Restart your device (turn it off and on again).
  • Log out of pixiv and log in again.
  • If you have multiple applications running, close them.
  • Delete temporary files other than bookmarks from your Internet browser, such as the cache, cookies, etc.
  • If you have any extensions or add-ons installed on your browser, turn them off or uninstall them.
  • If you have turned off referrers in your browser settings, turn them on.
    For more information, please refer to "What are referrers?"
  • Review the security settings or temporarily suspend your antivirus software.
  • Disable content blockers (e.g., ad blockers).
  • Allow JavaScript to run.

　  ＜If you are using the mobile version of pixiv...＞

  • Check the same items as the desktop version.
  • If you are able to view the site through the official app or a Wi-Fi connection, there is a possibility that you are unable to view it due to filtering by your mobile carrier. Please check the restrictions of your mobile carrier.

　  ＜If you are using pixiv on the iOS or Android app...＞

  • Restart the app.
  • Restart your device (turn it off and on again).
  • Uninstall and reinstall the app.
  • Delete the cache.

3. Check if there's a problem with your internet connection.

　  ＜If you are using pixiv via Wi-Fi or LAN...＞

  • Connect to a different Internet connection with a good connection.
  • Reconnect to the network or Wi-Fi.
  • Turn on and off your device's Airplane Mode to reset your connection.
  • Restart your router.
  • Unplug and reconnect your LAN cable.

　  ＜If you are using pixiv via mobile data...＞

  • Make sure your connection is stable.
  • Turn on and off your device's mobile data communication to reset your connection.
  • Check with your mobile carrier's support desk to see if the problem is caused by communication speed restrictions.

If the issue persists even after checking items 1 through 3, the site may be experiencing a high load due to high traffic on pixiv.
Please try to access the site after an hour or more has passed.
If the issue persists even after some time has passed, fill out the following template and contact us using our inquiry form.

Inquiry template:

  • Details of the issue:
  • What kind of troubleshooting you tried from items 1 through 3:
  • Date and time of the issue: MM/DD HH:mm
  • URL of the page where the issue occurred:
  • A screenshot of the page where the issue occurred:
  • What you were doing before the issue occurred:
  • Your internet connection environment: LAN/Wi-Fi/mobile data
  • The device where the error occurred: PC/Smartphone/Tablet/Other

I don't receive the verification e-mail when registering to pixiv

The verification e-mail will be sent from email address [no-reply@pixiv.net].
Be sure to add the above e-mail address to your e-mail account’s list of safe senders.

Also double check to make sure that the e-mail address is entered correctly.

In addition, your junk e-mail/spam filter settings may cause the e-mail to be blocked, or send the e-mail to your junk e-mail/spam folder.

If you do not receive the verification e-mail after a period of time, check the following:

▪ If the e-mail is not delivered to your phone’s e-mail address

  • Are domain specific access control and address specific access control set?
  • Do you use your cellphone service provider’s junk mail blocker service?
  • Is the transmission of e-mail delayed because of reception problems?

* To verify the relevant settings operations, refer the manual that came with your phone, or contact the cell phone company.

If the e-mail is not delivered to your PC’s address

  • Is there a transmission delay on the sender-side e-mail service provider?
  • Was the e-mail sorted into the junk e-mail/spam folder?
  • Has the sender’s e-mail server exceeded its capacity?
  • Is the sender’s e-mail server experiencing technical difficulties?
  • Has the sender’s e-mail service provider detected the message to be junk e-mail/spam and deleted the message?
  • Is the transmission of e-mail delayed because of reception problems?

* For information and the operation for changing settings, contact the PC manufacturer or provider.

  3. Enter the verification code on the Password Re-issue Form page.


  4. Proceed to the next page, where you'll be asked to enter a new password. Then click Reset.
    Choose a strong password that is difficult for a third party to guess.


  5. If your password was successfully reset, you should see the message "You've reset your password."
    You can now log in using your new password at the following URL.
    https://www.pixiv.net/

If you cannot use your registered e-mail address, or if you've otherwise forgotten all your account information, your account can be looked up using your payment history.

Please contact us and mention the necessary information for each payment method you've used.

 

■ For payments made with credit cards
We will have you go through a verification process on a specific webpage.
If you have lost an account with purchase history, please contact pixiv's support team.
* Please do not include your credit card number in the inquiry.

 

■ For payments made with PayPal

Please contact pixiv's support team with your PayPal transaction ID.
You can find your transaction IDs on PayPal's Transaction History page.

 

■ For payments made through NTT docomo payments (ドコモ払い)
* As of writing this article, docomo's website is only available in Japanese.
(1) Log in to My docomo
(2) Click "Usage fees" (ご利用料金)
(3) Under the "Charges" (料金) menu, click the "Details of payments made through Docomo Pay or d-Pay" (コモ払い・d払いの明細)
(4) Click "Usage history and payment details" (ご利用履歴・お支払い明細)
(5) Under the "pixiv" section, click "details" (詳細) to see the transaction number (決済番号). Then contact pixiv's support team with the transaction number (決済番号).


■ For payments made through au Kantan Kessai (auかんたん決済)
* As of writing this article, au's website is only available in Japanese.
(1) Access your "au ID"
(2) Select your account statement for au Kantan Kessai
(3) Select the triangle mark to open the details, and the transaction information number will be "transaction number" (決済番号).
Once you've saved the transaction number for your records, please contact pixiv's support team.

 

■ For payments made through SoftBank All-At-Once Payments (ソフトバンクまとめて支払い)
* As of writing this article, SoftBank's website is only available in Japanese.
(1) Log in to "My SoftBank"
(2) Click "Usage fees" (ご利用料金)
(3) Click "All-At-Once Payments" (まとめて支払い)
(4) Click "Review" (確認) under "Usage History" (ご利用履歴)
(5) If you have any charges, they'll be displayed as follows:
Please click the charges displayed.
① Under the service name "ピクシブ", the payment type "continuous payment" (継続課金)
② Under the service name "pixiv", the payment type "monthly payments" (月額課金)
(6) Once you've saved the "order number" (注文番号) for your records, please contact pixiv's support team.


■ For payments made through Google Play
https://support.google.com/googleplay/answer/2850369
Follow the procedures in the link above, and the order number will be "transaction number" (決済番号).
Once you've saved "the transaction number" (決済番号) for your records, please contact pixiv's support team.

■ For payments made through the App Store
We apologize for the inconvenience, but there currently isn't a way for our teams to look up pixiv accounts with the order number.

/hc/articles/24140513210905-What-are-aut:
What are authentication apps?

Authentication apps are apps that verify users. In the context of two-factor authentication, the phrase "authentication apps" refers to apps that generate unique time-limited verification codes.
For information on how to set up authentication apps, please check this article.

 

Examples of authentication apps

Commonly used authentication apps include Google Authenticator and Microsoft Authenticator. If you are new to authentication apps, we recommend using one of these two.

These authentication apps contain a backup feature. If the backup feature is enabled, your data may be restorable to another device even if your original device is lost or broken. To learn more, please check the Help pages on the websites of each authentication app.

 

Google Authenticator

Download iOS version here
Download Android version here

Check here for Official Help page

 

Microsoft Authenticator

Download iOS version here
Download Android version here

Check here for Official Help page

 

Why is it possible to use authentication apps from third-party companies?

Most authentication apps comply with a standard called Time-Based One-Time Password (TOTP). This standard stipulates a mechanism for generating a time-based, one-time-use verification code based on a Secret Key shared between the authentication app and the server.
pixiv incorporates an authentication feature that complies with TOTP, so any TOTP-compliant authentication app may be used with pixiv. pixiv Inc. does not provide its own authentication app, so to enable two-factor authentication, you must use an authentication app provided by a third-party company.

 

Warning when changing devices

If you change your device, you must transfer your authentication app data to your new device.
If you use an authentication app with a backup feature, you may be able to use the backup feature to restore your data on your new device, thereby transferring the data. However, in some cases, even with a backup feature, if the OS on the two devices is different, the data may not be able to be restored, so please check the authentication app Help pages in advance, before you change your device.

 

If you cannot transfer your data due to the features of your authentication app, you will need to reset your authentication app from the pixiv two-factor authentication settings page. Please do not delete the data on your old device until all the data has been successfully transferred to your new device.

/hc/articles/24140099211289-How-do-I-set:
How do I set two-factor authentication using an authentication app?

From the two-factor authentication settings page, follow the instructions on the screen to set an authentication app.
To learn more about authentication apps, please refer to this article.

 

The settings procedure is as follows.

 

① To set two-factor authentication, you must use an authentication app. If you don't already have an authentication app such as Google Authenticator or Microsoft Authenticator installed on your preferred device, please install an app in order to proceed.

 

Google Authenticator

Download iOS version here
Download Android version here

Microsoft Authenticator

Download iOS version here
Download Android version here

 

On this page, we will use Google Authenticator as an example.

 

②Please access the two-factor authentication settings page from the tab in your pixiv user settings, or from the URL below.

https://accounts.pixiv.net/two-factor-authentication

 

③You will be asked to confirm your pixiv account. Once confirmed, the two-factor authentication settings page will be displayed. Next, tap the "Enable" button.

 

 

④A 2D code will be displayed on the settings page. While leaving the settings page open, open your authentication app and tap the + button at the bottom right of the page. From the menu displayed, open the camera app, and scan the 2D code displayed on the settings page.
When a verification code is displayed in your authentication app, click the "Next" button on the settings page.

 

 

 

If you can't read the 2D code on the same device while you're using it, tap "My 2D code won't scan" on the settings page.
In your authentication app, open the Secret Key input page, then copy and input both the "Account" and the "Secret Key" items from the settings page. Next, leave the "Time-based" option as-is, and tap the "Add" button.
When a verification code is displayed in your authentication app, click the "Next" button on the settings page.

 

 

⑤

Input the 6-digit code displayed in the authentication app, then tap the "Confirm" button. In the following example, we will input the code "105528".
If multiple verification codes are displayed in your authentication app, please enter the code corresponding to the account you newly added.

If you are doing the whole procedure on the same device, you can tap the verification code to copy it.

 

 

 

⑥Two-factor authentication is now enabled. Backup codes that you can use if your device is lost or broken will be displayed. Please download them or take a screenshot, then store them in a safe location.

/hc/articles/20876141168665-If-I-can-t-l:
If I can't log in using two-factor authentication, what should I do?

If an error message is displayed when you send a verification code

Please confirm that you have entered the verification code correctly. Also, verification codes expire, so make sure you input the most recent verification code you received before it expires.
If you have multiple verification codes from your authentication app, make sure not to enter the verification code for a different account by mistake.

To secure your account, if you make too many failed attempts at entering your code, you will be locked out of your account even if you do eventually enter the correct code. In this case, please try again the next day.

If you cannot use your authentication app because your device has been lost or broken

If you are unable to use your verification app because your device is lost or broken, you can use a backup code to log in instead. Once you successfully log in, please change your two-factor authentication settings via the settings page immediately.

In addition, if there are other browsers you have set as trusted browsers and can already log into without using two-factor authentication, you can also reset your authentication app from those browsers.

 

At pixiv, we cannot disable two-factor authentication on your behalf, or re-issue backup codes. Thank you for your understanding.

/hc/articles/20876082054553-What-is-two-:
What is two-factor authentication?

Two-factor authentication is a method for increasing the security of your account.

When you enable two-factor authentication, you will be required to confirm your login information via two separate methods, which protects your account from unauthorized access by third parties.
You can enable or disable two-factor authentication from the two-factor authentication settings page.

About verification apps

Two-factor authentication uses authentication apps such as Google Authenticator and Microsoft Authenticator. If you don't already have an authentication app installed on your preferred device, please install an app in order to proceed.
To learn more about authentication apps, please check this article.

If you enable two-factor authentication using an authentication app, you will need to use a six-digit verification code generated by the app in order to log in.
If you can't log in using two-factor authentication, please check this article.

About backup codes

If you enable two-factor authentication, a list of backup codes will be generated for you automatically. Each backup code can only be used once.
If your device is lost or broken and you can't log in using your authentication app, you can use a backup code to log in.
If you cannot log in with your authentication app or your backup codes, you will be permanently logged out of your account, so if you enable two-factor authentication, please make sure to keep your backup codes safe at all times.

About trusted browsers

When you check "Trust this browser" and log in using two-factor authentication, you will be able to skip the two-factor authentication for a certain period of time from the next time you log in from the same browser on the same device. If you log in on a different browser or a different device, you will need to go through the two-factor authentication process as usual.
Please only use the trusted browser feature on a device that you do not share with others.

In the following cases, even if you used a trusted browser in the past, you will still need to go through the two-factor authentication process to log in.

  • If you log in to your trusted browser after the time period has expired
  • If you log in to a browser for which you removed the "trusted browser" setting
  • If you log in to your browser in Incognito, secret, or private browsing mode
  • If you log in after erasing your cookies and/or browsing history

Disable trusted browser settings

From the two-factor authentication settings page, under the "Trusted browsers" item, if you click the "Revoke all" button, all your trusted browser settings will be revoked.
If you set a trusted browser on a shared device by mistake, or a device on which you had trusted browser settings installed is lost or stolen, please use this procedure to disable trusted browser settings in order to protect your account security.

/hc/articles/6639949620121-Why-do-I-need:
Why do I need a verification code when I log in?

In order to prevent unauthorized access to your account, we are confirming your identity whenever you attempt to log into your account through your password.

You will be logged in once you've entered the confirmation code that was sent to your registered e-mail address.

* This confirmation code will expire in 15 minutes. Please enter the code within 15 minutes.

■ If you didn't get the e-mail

The confirmation mail will be sent from no-reply@pixiv.net.

If you have limits on the domain names that you can receive in your e-mail address, please permit messages from the above e-mail address.

Additionally, the e-mail might get sorted into your spam folder, so we ask that you check all of your e-mail folders.

■ If you were not attempting to log in

It is possible that a third party is trying to access your account. Please change your password from the URL below.
https://accounts.pixiv.net/password/change

You can also check your login history from the following URL.
https://accounts.pixiv.net/security-history

/hc/articles/235582748-What-is-pixiv-ID:
What is pixiv ID?

Your pixiv ID is the login ID that you enter when you log in to pixiv. You can also use your e-mail address for this purpose instead of a pixiv ID. However, this will not turn your e-mail address into a pixiv ID. Your pixiv ID is important registration information. Be sure not to forget it and to keep it safe.

Your pixiv ID can be changed once per account.
Become a pixiv Premium user to change your ID as many times as you like.
Once you change it, you cannot revert to the previous pixiv ID.
After changing your pixiv ID, you won't be able to change it again for 30 days.

In the pixiv ID field, enter the string of text that you would like to use, composed of alphanumeric characters, hyphens ( – ), and underscores ( _ ). You cannot register IDs identical to those that are already registered on pixiv. If you receive an error message that says that the ID is already in use, enter a different string of text and try again.

/hc/articles/235583728-What-are-pixiv-Pr:
What are pixiv Premium's fees and available payment methods?

You can use various payment methods, such as PayPal, GooglePlay payment, App Store payment, e-money, Japanese credit card payment, carrier payment (available to customers in Japan), and convenience store payment (available to customers in Japan).

Register on your browser

If you choose credit card payment (please note that some credit cards issued outside of Japan may not be accepted), you will be charged 550 JPY per month (tax included), or you can opt for a long-term discount plan. VISA, MASTERCARD, JCB, AMEX, and DINERS cards are all accepted.
About billing:
You will be billed when you first register, and when your membership is automatically renewed.
The fee for carrier payment is 550 JPY (tax included).
You can use au Easy payment, Docomo payment, or SoftBank payment (available only to customers in Japan).
About billing:
On au Easy payment or Docomo payment (Japan only)
You get billed at the time you register, and then on the first of every month.
On SoftBank payment (Japan only)
You get billed at the time you register, and then on the date your registration automatically renews.
If you pay via PayPal, you can choose a monthly fee of 550 JPY (tax included) or you can opt for a long-term discount plan.
About billing:
You will be billed when you first register, and when your membership is automatically renewed.
If you pay via web money, convenience store, etc., you can pay a bundled 6-month fee of 3000 JPY (tax included) or a 12-month fee of 5500 JPY (tax included).
About billing:
You will be billed when you first register, and when your membership is renewed. 

Register from the app

If you use Google Play payment, you will be asked to download the pixiv app from the Google Play store. You can then register from the pixiv Premium menu within the app.
About billing:
You will be billed when you first register, and when your membership is automatically renewed.
If you use App Store payment, you will be asked to download the pixiv app from the App Store. You can then register from the pixiv Premium menu within the app.
*Please check in the app for details on fees when you pay for Premium through the app.
About billing:
You will be billed when you first register, and when your membership is automatically renewed.
If you would like to change your current billing method, please go to the link below.
pixiv Premium registration info page

/hc/articles/235644947-I-want-to-continu:
I want to continue my pixiv premium membership.

Your membership will automatically be renewed until you cancel it if your payment method is one of the following: credit card, cellphone carrier, PayPal, Google Play, or App Store.

If your payment method is ticket voucher (payments through the convenience store, WebMoney, or BitCash), your membership will be renewed if you purchase additional vouchers. You can purchase additional vouchers at any time on the "Edit pixiv Premium membership information" page. Also, the screen below will appear 15 days before the expiration date of your membership.


(*The screen will be displayed only on the Desktop version of pixiv)

Click "Update pixiv Premium" to go to the payment screen and extend your membership by renewing it.

Also, please note that the new term of your membership will not overlap with the existing term.

For example, if the existing expiration date is June 30, 2019, and you purchase an additional membership for 12 months on June 20, 2019, the new registration date becomes July 1, 2019 and the new expiration date will be 12 months later and a day before, which is June 30, 2020.

/hc/articles/360005789034-About-the-3-Mo:
About the 3-Month, 6-Month, and 12-Month (long-term discount) plans

These plans are services that will charge you once every several months (3, 6, or 12 months).

Unlike the monthly plan that charges you every month, if you are subscribed to either one of the 3, 6, or 12-month plans, you can enjoy the Premium service during the term of your choice and will be charged only once within the said term.

For example, if your 3-month membership plan begins on March 15, you will be charged 3 months worth of the membership fee on March 15. You will subsequently be able to use the Premium service for the next 3 months, until June 14.

In this case, the next billing date will be June 15 and you will automatically be charged 3 months worth of the membership fee on that day.

By subscribing to the long-term discount plans, you can enjoy pixiv Premium at the following discounted price:
・ 3 months Plan: 1,600 yen, renewed every 3 months, enjoy 3% off the monthly fee
・ 6 months Plan: 3,000 yen, renewed every 6 months, enjoy 9% off the monthly fee
・ 12 months Plan: 5,500 yen, renewed every 12 months, enjoy 16% off the monthly fee

/hc/articles/360005909733-I-am-already-a:
I am already a Premium user, can I switch to a plan for a different term?

・For credit card or PayPal payments

You can change your membership plan from the Check/edit subscription info page and your next billing will be based on the new plan.


・For ticket voucher payments (payments through the convenience store, WebMoney, or BitCash)

If you wish to use your plan for the next period with the ticket voucher payment, you can extend it at any time from the Check/edit subscription info page.

You will be transferred to the new plan a day after your current plan's expiration date.

You can also check the expiration date from the Check/edit subscription info page.

The following screen will be displayed 15 days before the expiration date.


(*Only displayed on the Desktop version of pixiv)

If you wish to change to a plan for a different term and choose ticket voucher as the payment method, click "Update pixiv Premium" and you will be taken to a screen where you can select another payment method and replace your current payment method.

If you wish to change to a plan for a different term and choose credit card or PayPal as the payment method, you can change your payment method the day after the expiration date of your membership.

Please access the pixiv Premium Introduction page, select a period, and register.


・For cellphone carrier payments

If your payment method is the cellphone carrier payment and you wish to use the long-term discount plans, you need to cancel your membership once and register for the long-term discount plan.

You will be able to register for a long-term discount plan after the termination date.

Please register from the pixiv Premium Introduction page.


・For App Store or Google Play payments

If your payment method is the App Store or Google Play and you wish to choose a long-term discount plan, you will have to cancel your membership once and re-register for a long-term discount plan a day after the scheduled cancellation date. You can view the scheduled cancellation date on the page that manages cancellation procedures on your application store. Learn how to check the scheduled cancellation date by visiting the Help page.

You can still use the features of pixiv Premium until the scheduled cancellation date even after you have completed the cancellation procedure.
Once your membership has been canceled, you will be able to register for a long-term discount plan.
Please register from the pixiv Premium Introduction page.

/hc/articles/235644967-I-want-to-unsubsc:
I want to unsubscribe from pixiv Premium

Before canceling your membership
Please note that we do not offer day-by-day refunds for the unused part of your membership.

 

For credit card and PayPal payments:

If you wish to cancel your pixiv Premium membership, please do so from the "Edit pixiv Premium membership information" page. A confirmation email will be sent to you after your cancellation application is complete.

Once you cancel your pixiv Premium membership, you can use pixiv Premium features until the end of the subscription period that you paid for*. After the expiration date, your pixiv Premium membership will be canceled automatically.

*Subscription period: In case of monthly payments, up to one day before the registration/renewal date of the previous month (if paying on November 17th, until December 16th).

For PayPal Payments, please note that you might have temporary difficulties canceling your current plan if the renewal date corresponds with PayPal's system update period. Please anticipate your cancelation or request your membership cancelation once PayPal's system update is complete.

You can also cancel your membership directly from PayPal. Select "pixiv" from your transaction history, then Details, then Show Details. You can cancel your membership by clicking the "Cancel" button on the Details page.

 

For Google Play subscription:

You can cancel your pixiv Premium membership from the Google Play store.

  1. Open the Google Play store app
  2. Select "Account Information" from the MENU key to display a list of apps you're subscribed to
  3. Select "pixiv" and tap "Cancel"
  4. Tap "Cancel Subscription"
  5. Your Premium membership will be canceled automatically after its expiration date

If you don't own an Android device, please try canceling your subscription from the browser version of the Google Play store.

 

For App Store subscription:

You can cancel your pixiv Premium membership from your iPhone settings.

  1. Open the Settings from your Home screen
  2. Tap "iTunes & App Store" from the Menu
  3. Tap your Apple ID (if your Apple ID is not displayed, enter the required information in order to sign in)
  4. View Apple ID > Enter password
  5. On the Account Settings page, tap "Subscriptions"
  6. From your subscriptions list, tap on "pixiv"
  7. Tap "Cancel Subscription"
  8. Your Premium membership will be canceled automatically after its expiration date

If you don't own an iOS device, please try canceling your subscription from iTunes on your PC. You can do so from "Account Information".

/hc/articles/235583788-What-sorts-of-ben:
What sorts of benefits are available to pixiv Premium members?

By registering as a premium member, you will be able to enjoy the following benefits:

  1. Reupload illustrations and manga.
  2. Search for illustrations, manga, and novels in order of popularity.
  3. Get access to the analysis of posted illustrations, manga, and novel contents.
  4. Hide all advertisements from pixiv for PC, pixiv for mobile devices, pixiv for smartphone browser and the official pixiv app.
  5. Use fanzine (doujinshi) printing discount services.
  6. Choose to display or hide newly posted My pixiv illustrations for each user.
  7. Group the My pixiv and users that you are following.
  8. The maximum number of My pixiv and newly posted illustrations of users that you follow increases from 2,000 to 5,000 results.
  9. Use animated GIFs as your profile picture.
  10. Use CLIP STUDIO PAINT DEBUT.
  11. Your viewing history will be displayed.
  12. Mute duplicate contents that contain specified tags.
  13. Create groups.

We plan to release more and more new features going forward.

Click here for details of pixiv Premium’s functions and to apply for your pixiv Premium account.

pixiv Premium users can use the Schedule Post feature to select a date and time for their posts.
This feature is currently available for illustrations, manga, and novels.

 

Notes about scheduling posts

  • You can schedule posts up to a week ahead, setting the time on a half-hour basis.
  • You can schedule up to 10 posts at the same time.
  • When scheduling a post, you cannot insert Image Response.
  • After scheduling a post you can change your work's caption and title, but you cannot replace or add images.

 

■ If you wish to schedule an illustration or manga on the desktop version
Check "Schedule submission" at the bottom of the work submission form and specify your desired time and date.


You can check your scheduled post on the Dashboard page.

 

■ If you wish to schedule an illustration or manga on the smartphone version
Check "Select a posting date" at the bottom of the work submission form and specify your desired time and date.

You can check your scheduled post on the Dashboard page.

 

Notes about scheduling novels

  • You can schedule posts up to a week ahead, setting the time on a half-hour basis.
  • You can schedule up to 10 posts at the same time.
  • When scheduling a post, you cannot use Image Response.

 

■ If you wish to schedule a novel on the desktop version
Select "Scheduled post" at the bottom of the work submission form and specify your desired time and date.
You can check your scheduled post on the Dashboard page.

 

■ If you wish to schedule a novel on the smartphone version
Check "Select a posting date" at the bottom of the work submission form and specify your desired time and date.
You can check your scheduled post on the Dashboard page.

/hc/articles/13276278766489-What-is-AI-g:
What is AI-generated work?

We define "AI-generated" work as work in which all or most of the production process is carried out by AI.

We define AI-generated work as work that meets the following criteria.

  • Illustrations
    • An artwork in which all or most of the production process is carried out by AI.
    • For example, an illustration created by combining specific prompts and posted with little to no editing, regardless of format (e.g. text, images).
  • Novels, manga, Ugoira
    • A work in which all or most of the production process, including the story, writing, placement, drawing, and animation, is carried out by AI.
    • For example, work created by combining specific prompts and posted with little to no editing, regardless of format (e.g. text, images). However, work that includes AI-generated resources as secondary content (for example, images in a novel) does not need to be set as AI-generated.

/hc/articles/235645927-Can-I-set-the-pri:
Can I set the privacy settings for my work?

You can choose one of three options for your privacy settings. They are: "Public", "My pixiv only", and "Private". If you make your work public, it will be displayed in the search results.

Public: Your works will be public to all users.
My pixiv only: Your works will only be visible to people who are added to your My pixiv. (What's My pixiv?)
Private: Your works aren't public. Only you will be able to see them with this setting.

Think of a caption as a text that introduces your content. Post text that explains any features of the content you posted to use this function. You can also enter links to your past content and links to other users’ content as well.

By using tags you can change or emphasize the color of caption's text.

/hc/articles/235585008-What-are-the-tags:
What are the tags on works posted to pixiv?

When you make a post, you need to include at least one tag. It's even more fun to search for works that use the same tags as your posts.

Furthermore, it's a lot easier to look for works on pixiv when the appropriate tags are attached.
Please note, however, that it can take a bit of time for a work to show up in the search results for a certain tag after you post it.
Works can have up to 10 tags.
In addition to the creator, other users on pixiv can attach and remove tags.
If the creator doesn't want other users to edit the tags on their works, they can lock that work's tags.
* The creator can do this at the time of posting or by editing their work and checking the box, "Don't allow other users to edit tags".
Only the creator can remove tags they've personally added to their work. Other users' tags can be removed by anyone (unless the creator locked their tags).

・History of deleted tags
You can press the + button to open a work's tag history. This will display previously deleted tags, which you can edit or restore.
It's useful when an appropriate tag was accidentally deleted.

I want to select a specific page or panel to feature as the thumbnail image for my manga

 

If you would like to select a specific page or panel to feature as the thumbnail image for your manga, you can do so using the desktop version of pixiv.

The mobile and app versions of pixiv do not currently support this feature.

The procedure for selecting the thumbnail is explained below.

 

How to set the thumbnail for a new post

How to change the thumbnail for a previously posted work

 

＜How to set the thumbnail for a new post＞

1. Select "Post your work" from the top menu on the pixiv main page

2. Select "Manga" and click "Select files" to upload your work

3. Click the "Adjust" button in the thumbnail field

4. Select your preferred page or panel and click "Apply" to set the thumbnail

[I want to select a specific page]

 

By clicking the right and left page scroll buttons (＜ and ＞), you can select the page you'd like to use as a thumbnail.

 

[I want to select a specific panel]

 

You can drag images to create a thumbnail of a specific panel.

You can click and drag the four corners of the image to make the selected area larger or smaller.

 

＜How to change the thumbnail for a previously posted work＞

 

pixiv Premium members can repost a work via that work's details page.

 

1. Go to the dashboard and click on the pen icon for the work for which you'd like to change the thumbnail

2. Click "Resubmit artwork"

3. Click the "Adjust" button in the thumbnail field

4. From the thumbnail edit page, select your preferred page or frame and click "Apply" to set the thumbnail

/hc/articles/235584588-How-can-I-post-il:
How can I post illustrations on pixiv?

After you log in to your pixiv account, you can post using the "Post your work" button.
* Please note that you can only post work that you created yourself, for which you hold the copyrights. Posting others' work without permission is in violation of our Terms of Use, so please refrain from doing so.


▶On desktop
▶On mobile
▶On the app


On desktop

  1. Go to the "Post your work" button on the top menu, and click on Illustrations.


  2. Click on Select files.

  3. Select the file(s) you'd like to post. You can select multiple images by holding down the Shift key and clicking on the images, or by dragging with the mouse. After selecting, click Open.
    * You can select multiple files to upload.
    * Each file must be no more than 32MB. You can post JPG, GIF, or PNG files. You cannot post animated GIFs.

    When posting multiple files, in preview mode, you can change the order of the images by clicking and dragging. Also, in preview mode, you can adjust the image thumbnail.

  4. In order to post, you must input/select the following items.
    - Tags
    - Age restriction
    - AI-generated work
    * For details on AI-generated work, click here.
    Please input/select other items as needed.

  5. Click on Post at the bottom of the screen.


  6. If your post has been uploaded successfully, you will see the message "Your work was posted".
    Click here for info about re-posts.

On mobile

  1. Tap the upper left menu button.


  2. In the menu, tap Post, then select Illustrations.

  3. Add images you'd like to post. You can adjust the thumbnail from Preview mode.
    * You can select multiple files to upload.
    * Each file must be no more than 32MB. You can post JPG, GIF, or PNG files. You cannot post animated GIFs.

  4. In order to post, you must input/select the following items.
    - Tags
    - Age restriction　
    - AI-generated work
    * For details on AI-generated work, click here.
    Please input/select other items as needed.
  5. Tap Post at the bottom of the page to finish your post.
    If your post has been uploaded successfully, you will see the message "Your work was posted".
    Click here for info about re-posts.

On the app

  1. From My page, tap Submit Work, then Illust.

  2. Your image folder will open, so you can select the images you would like to post, in order, as a group. (The order will be displayed on the upper right of the images you tap).
    * You can upload multiple files.
    * Each file must be no more than 32MB. You can post JPG, GIF, or PNG files. You cannot post animated GIFs.

  3. Select/input required items including Tags, Browsing restriction, AI-generated work, Sexual Content, and more, then tap Submit at the bottom of the screen to finish your post.
    * For details on AI-generated images, go here.

    If your post has been uploaded successfully, the work you posted will appear on your works page.

    The re-post feature is only available for pixiv Premium users, please try it on desktop or mobile versions.
    Go here for details.

/hc/articles/235584708-I-can-t-post-an-i:
I can't post an illustration

If you're having issues trying to post an illustration, please try the following:


・Checking the file size
Illustrations are limited to 32 MB per image. The entire post is limited to 200 MB.
・Resaving all files
If an image file is corrupted, the whole artwork cannot be posted.
・Uploading only a couple files at a time.
You may be able to find the source of your issue by uploading only a couple files, and then gradually increasing the number of files you upload.

If the above steps don't resolve your issue, it's possible that your device or uploading environment may be to blame. As such, please try the following:
・Ensuring that you have good connectivity before reuploading
・Deleting your cache and cookies
・Updating your browser to the latest version
・Restarting your device
Additionally, we ask that you try a different browser to see if that fixes the issue. We recommend the following browsers:
---------------------------------
Latest version of Google Chrome
http://www.google.com/chrome/
Latest version of Firefox
https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/new/
---------------------------------

If you're using an iPad:
Cloud services like iCloud cannot be used to upload data directly.
You'll need to save the data locally on your device, such as in your photo library, and then try reuploading it that way.
Please note that there are times when your phone plan or device specs may be preventing you from uploading illustrations. In these cases, we ask that you please upload your works via a desktop computer.

/hc/articles/115000289673-I-want-to-crea:
I want to create a new manga series

You can create manga series from the desktop and mobile versions of pixiv.
It cannot be done from the app.
The procedures are as follows:

＜On desktop＞

  1. Please go to your "Dashboard", then "Works" > "Manga" > "Series". From there, click "Create series" or "Create manga series".
    * For a manga that has already been posted, you can also go to its "Edit post" page to both create a series and add a work to a series.


  2. Please enter a title and a summary. Click the + symbol to add a manga work. If you click the "View all" button to the right of the work, you'll open the "Works in this series" menu.

  3. You can change the order of the works by dragging and dropping the ≡ symbol to the right of the works. * The topmost work will be the most recent episode.

  4. Once you have decided on the order of the works, please click "Confirm" and then "Save changes". The completed series page will open. Feel free to add a cover of your choosing.

＜On mobile＞

  1. From "Manga series", please tap "Create manga series".


  2. You can add a cover image of your choosing, a title, and a summary. Please scroll down and tap the + button by "Works". From this "Select work" menu, add the manga works you want and then please tap "Confirm".


  3. If you tap the "View all" button to the right of the works, you'll be able to change the order of the works by dragging and dropping the ≡ symbol. * The topmost work will be the most recent episode.


  4. Once you have decided on the order of the works, please tap "Confirm" and then "Save changes". Your series should now be completed.

The Custom Colors cover settings on the novel posting page allow you to choose two colors, which will appear in the cover design.

▶️ On desktop
▶️ On mobile
▶️ On the app

On desktop

  1. To use the Custom Colors cover feature, from "Cover" on the novel posting page, select a cover template with the two-colored icon. To view all cover templates where you can use the Custom Colors feature, select "Custom Colors" instead of "All".

  2. Choose any cover that allows custom color settings, then select "Edit Cover" from the "Cover preview" field. You can then edit "Col1" and "Col2", and your chosen colors will appear on specific parts of the cover template.

  3. You can select colors from the palette, the custom menu, or by entering the code for the specific color.
    ・The colors you recently selected will appear on the palette under "Recent colors". The six most recent colors you chose will appear in the "Recent colors" section of the palette.
    *Font colors will not be saved as "Recent colors".
    ・To return to the default color settings, click "Reset color 1" and "Reset color 2".

On mobile

  1. To use the Custom Colors cover feature, from "Cover" on the novel posting page, select a cover template with the two-colored icon. To view all cover templates where you can use the Custom Colors feature, select "Custom Colors" instead of "All".

  2. Choose any cover that allows custom color settings, then select "Edit Cover" from the "Cover preview" field. You can then edit "Col1" and "Col2", and your chosen colors will appear on specific parts of the cover template.

  3. You can select colors from the palette, the custom menu, or by entering the code for the specific color.

    *Font colors will not be saved as "Recent colors".
    ・To return to the default color settings, tap "Reset color 1" and "Reset color 2".

/hc/articles/360000653441-What-are-genre:
What are genres?

Genres are classification categories that make it easier to browse original novels.

You can set one genre for an original one-shot story or series.
* You cannot set separate genres for works within the same series.

When you classify a novel (whether it's a one-shot or in a series) as an original work, you'll need to select a genre for it. If your work doesn't fit into any of the categories listed, please select "Other".

The list of genres is as follows:

Romance
Stories mainly about romance. Love stories, rom-coms, etc.

Isekai fantasy
Fantasy works set in another world.

Contemporary fantasy
Works that use fantasy elements in the modern world. (Also called "modern fantasy")

Mystery
Works about solving mysteries. Detective stories, etc.

Horror
Works focused on terror. Ghost stories, etc.

Sci-Fi
Works based on scientific ideas and fantasy.

Literature
Works with an emphasis on true literary artistry.

Drama
Works about people's lives and emotions. Stories about professions, modern drama, etc.

Historical pieces
Works that revolve around past eras, people, and events. (Also called "historical fiction")

BL 
Works about gay relationships and romance. Boys' love.

Yuri
Works about lesbian relationships and romance. Girls' love.

For kids
Works created mainly for children. Juvenile literature, fairy tales, etc.

Poetry
Works written in verse or prose. Lyrics, poems, etc.

Essays/non-fiction
Works about the creator's actual experience or other true events.

Screenplays/scripts
Scripts or instructions for plays, performances, tabletop roleplaying, etc.

Reviews/opinion pieces
Works that discuss a particular topic, express the creator's emotions, etc.

Other
Works that don't fit within the other genres.

I want to set a work's language on Novels

You can set a work's language from the Novel posting page.
When searching for works, you can refine your search by language from Search options.

* It may take some time for posted or edited work to show up in the search results.

 

 

The default setting is for the language to be determined automatically based on the language of the body text of the work.

The languages supported for the automatic feature are Japanese, English, Korean, Simplified Chinese, and Traditional Chinese. If the language can't be determined, it will be set to the same language as the work posted before it.

If you select Work language, you can manually set the language of the work.

If your work's language is not listed among the options you can select, please set it as Other.
In this case, please contact us regarding the language not listed via our Feedback. We will consider adding that language to our list.

Please enjoy the work with the text you've converted.

/hc/articles/900000378663-How-do-I-set-t:
How do I set term conversion within my own novel?

From the reference material tab on the Series detail page, you can allow other users to convert terms that you've uploaded.

You cannot give permission for term conversion for works created by other users.

■Setting up term conversion
1. Choose the series in which you want to enable term conversion. Open the details page and click on the "Reference materials" tab.

2. Open the category tab for which you want to set term conversion. If there are no categories, please create one.

3. Click "Create term" or the pencil icon next to the term you wish to edit.

4. Enter the title and an explanation of the term, then enable "Allow other users to change this term". Then click "save changes".
You can enable term conversion for up to 10 terms per series.

5. Term conversion has been set.
When others view your work, they can now replace these terms with their own text.
When using these terms within your work, pay attention to your use of upper and lowercase characters, as well as your use of spaces.
Also, special tags cannot be converted.

To learn how to convert terms with your own input while reading someone else's work, please read this documentation.

/hc/articles/235646007-What-s-age-restri:
What's age restriction?

If you would like to post content unsuitable for users under the age of 18 to pixiv, you can adjust the age restriction so such works are only displayed to users who can view such material.

In order to post works with content unsuitable for users under the age of 18, you will need to satisfy the following requirements:

Have an account with the display of age-restricted works (R-18) and grotesque works (R-18G) enabled.


* Your birthday will need to be set to change the age restriction setting.

When posting works, you absolutely must make sure you set the appropriate age restriction according to the list below:

All ages
There's nothing within the work that needs to be age-restricted
Only mild sexual depictions (Novel works do not need to set this)
Includes depictions alluding to sexual act and behaviors, or depict actions that imitate sexual acts and behavior regardless of age and sex; the depiction of kisses, hugs, and underwear.
Emphasis on breasts, cleavage, nipples, buttocks, groin areas, and the like; compositions that focus on any of these body parts.
Depictions of characters wearing incredibly revealing clothes, of characters in swimsuits, of characters in see-through or transparent clothing, as well as of characters who clearly appear naked.

 

R-18 (Sexually explicit content)
Anything sexually related, or works that depict contact between genitalia, or anything which strongly resembles any sexual act.

R-18G (grotesque/violent content)
Scenes with intense violence, ideas, or realistic depictions of life that could be highly dangerous or disturbing to minors.

Works marked as R-18 or R-18G will not be visible to the following users:

Users under 18
Users who have set their accounts viewing restrictions to not display R-18 or R-18G works.


Please note that tagging your work with R-18 or R-18G does not limit who is able to view it. You will need to manually set the appropriate age restriction.

 


Furthermore, you will need to make sure your works are appropriately censored using pixelation or other techniques according to our Guidelines. pixiv is based in Japan, and as such, Japanese law (including those regarding pornography) applies to all content posted on pixiv.
If we determine that work you've posted is not taking the appropriate censorship actions, we take measures that include suspending your account.

 

Age restrictions for novel series

You can set the age restrictions for a series based on the content of the works belonging to that series.

If the series includes R-18 works...
The series' age restriction can't be set to All ages.

If the series includes R-18G works...
The series' age restriction can't be set to All ages or R-18.

If you wish to select an unavailable age restriction, remove R-18 and R-18G works from the series first.

/hc/articles/235645907-Can-I-post-conten:
Can I post content classed as R-18?

Users can post age-restricted content (R-18 or R-18G), provided they are 18 years of age or older, and provided that the user’s account is set to allow the display of age-restricted content (R-18 or R-18G). However, you must set the following on the upload screen.

  • For content that contains sexually explicit material:
    Select the "Sexually Explicit Material (R-18)" viewing restriction.
  • For content that contains grotesque material:
    Select the "Grotesque Material (R-18G)" viewing restriction.

* Simply adding the R-18 and R-18G tags to content will not restrict who can view the content. Make sure that you also set the viewing restrictions for your content.
* Moreover, make sure to read and observe the pixiv guidelines.

/hc/articles/235646387-I-would-like-to-k:
I would like to know how to search for content on pixiv.

▪ To search for AAA
Enter: AAA
Enter a keyword and click the Search button.

[AND searches]
▪ To search for content that contains two keywords, "AAA" and "BBB"
Enter: AAA BBB
Enter a space between the keywords and then click the Search button.

[Minus search]
▪ To exclude content that contains the keyword "CCC" from the search results of content that contains the keyword "AAA"
Enter: AAA -CCC
Enter a "-" in front of the keyword that you would like to exclude from the search results and click the Search button.
* Make sure that you enter a single-byte dash

[OR searches]
▪ To search for content that contains the keyword "AAA" or "BBB"
Enter: AAA OR BBB
Enter the word OR between keywords and then click the Search button.
* Make sure that you enter OR by using single-byte characters.

[Keywords + OR searches]
▪ To search for content that includes "AAA" as well as either "BBB" or "CCC"
Enter: AAA (BBB OR CCC)
Enter text structured like the search above and click the Search button. (* You must enter a space before and after the parentheses.)

Uppercase, lowercase, double-byte, and single-byte characters are not differentiated.
For example, a search for both "AAA" and "aaa" will yield the same search results.

[Size-specific searches]
▪ You can specify the size of the content you would like to search for. The following are each sizes that can be searched for.
Small (1,000 px x 1,000 px or smaller)
Medium (1,001 px x 1,001 to 3,000 px x 3,000 px)
Large (3,000 px x 3,000 px or larger)
Portrait (Allows you to search for content that is longer vertically than horizontally.)
Landscape (Allows you to search for content that is longer horizontally than vertically.)

[Time period specified content search]
▪ Allows you to search for content posted during a specified period of time.

[Proportions search]
▪ Allows you to specify searches for content that has portrait, landscape, or square proportions.

[Tool-specified search]
▪ Allows you to search for content created using a specific tool such
as SAI, Photoshop, Metasequoia, a mechanical pencil, or a regular pencil to name a few.

[User search]
▪ On the search results page, select the [User] tab.

How can I improve my search results?

In your search options, you can filter search results by the date the work was posted and the number of bookmarks. For illustrations, you can also filter by resolution and aspect ratio, while for novels, you can filter by character count and language.

If you check "Bundle works by the same creator", you can bundle all works by the same creator on the search results page. If you bundle works by the same creator, you can view a list of all the applicable works by that creator by clicking/tapping the "+n works" button in the search results for that creator.

You can also expand keyword searches to include not only partial or perfect matches for tags, but also titles and captions. Our search engine also allows AND searches and minus searches. To learn more, please check this article.

Depending on your browsing restrictions and whether or not you have chosen to display AI-generated work or use the mute feature, your searches may turn up fewer results.

I want to know how to comment and use stickers

You can comment on works and add stickers by using the comment box below the post.
Comments are limited to a maximum of 140 characters.
The work's creator can post comments on their own work.

If the creator disables "Comments", other users will not be able to send stickers or comment on the work.

The work's creator can also delete all comments and stickers posted.
Furthermore, even if you're not the creator, you're able to delete your own comments and stickers.

How do I disable comments and stickers for my work?

You can disable comments and stickers by switching "Comments" off, from the work posting page or the edit work page.

If you disable comments on a work that you had posted previously, all comments received up until that point will be hidden. Switching comments back on will display all hidden comments.

Even when comments are disabled, the comment counter in your Dashboard will still count all comments received up until that point.

Please check the following to see how to switch off comments, and how the comments section will be displayed.

 

▶︎On desktop

▶︎On mobile

▶︎On the app

 

On desktop

  • Set "Comments" to OFF via the work posting page or the edit work page.
  • Works that have comments disabled will be displayed as below

 

On mobile

  • Open "Other settings" on the work posting or edit work page, and switch "Enable comments on your work" off.
  • Works that have comments disabled will be displayed as below.

 

On the app

  • Switch "Comments" off at the bottom of the work posting page.

/hc/articles/235585288-I-would-like-to-v:
I would like to view age restricted contents. (R-18/R-18G)

On pixiv, R-18 works are those that include sexual content, and R-18G is those that contain grotesque content.
Please go to Settings > User settings > Viewing restriction and change each to “Show” if you want to browse age-restricted content(R-18・R-18G works). You will need to set your date of birth in order to change the Viewing Restrictions.
By default and for those under the age of 18, it will be set to “Hide”. Those under the age of 18 cannot change their viewing restrictions.
Furthermore, viewing restrictions cannot be changed from the app version of pixiv. Please change them from the desktop or mobile versions of pixiv.
Even works tagged R-18 or R-18G still be displayed to all users if the creator has not set an “age restriction” for each work. If you find a work that violates our Terms of Use or Guidelines, please refer to this.
Additionally, you cannot just hide only R-18 works and display R-18G works.

/hc/articles/235585348-My-viewing-restri:
My viewing restrictions are set to block age-restricted material (R-18 or R-18G), but I can still see works with R-18 tags

Works containing age-restricted content (R-18/R-18G) must be within pixiv's Guidelines. In order to prevent minors under the age of 18 from viewing inappropriate works, the proper viewing restriction must be set at the time of posting.

There are occasions when creators do not appropriately tag content inappropriate for minors when they post it.

We apologize for the inconvenience, but if you find content that violates the Terms of Use or the guidelines, please report it. For illustrations, manga, and Ugoira, this can be done clicking the work, going to "..." underneath the work, and clicking "Report a problem". For novels, please report from "More information about this work".

Furthermore, please note that works tagged with an R-18 label are still open to all ages.
In order to appropriately set age restrictions, it is necessary to change the settings through either the posting page or "Edit post".

  • For sexual content
    Select Contains sexual content (R-18) for the Viewing restriction
  • For ero-guro or disturbing content
    Select Contains ero-guro content (R-18G) for the Viewing restriction

I can't browse certain works from the country/region where I live

pixiv operates in strict compliance with laws, so based on the region of operation (by both the company and each community member), certain content may be subject to restrictions such as display restrictions if the content violates the law in the region from which the person is browsing.

Your location will be set automatically based on the region from which you access pixiv. If the automatic settings are wrong, we apologize for the inconvenience, but we ask that you change them manually. You can check and update your location settings as follows.

 

■On desktop

1. Log in to pixiv and access the Settings page.

2. Change your country/region using the pulldown menu.

 

■On mobile

1. Log in to pixiv and access the Settings page.

2. Go to "Language and location settings" and then change your country/region using the pulldown menu.

 

■On the app

You cannot change your country/region settings using the pixiv app.

Please use the mobile or desktop versions of pixiv to change your settings through your browser.

/hc/articles/235584528-What-is-a-referre:
What is a referrer?

When you click on a link on a webpage that sends you to another site, that link can be modified to have the previous webpage as the referrer.

Some of pixiv's webpages use referrers for displaying on the site.

It's possible that some of pixiv's referrers may not work as intended depending on your browser settings, your plugins, your addons, etc. Please check to see if temporarily disabling your plugins and addons fixes your display issue.

Additionally, it's also possible that the settings of your antivirus program or other security software may be interfering with the referrers. Please try changing the referrer permissions. (For information on how to do this, contact the software company directly.)

/hc/articles/115003439868-How-can-I-set-:
How can I set up a secure password?

In order to use pixiv more securely, please use a password that you are not using for other sites and that a third party won't be able to guess.

  • Set a password with many characters
  • Don't use the same login ID/password as other services
  • Don't use "repeated letters" in the password
  • Do not use your date of birth or phone number in your password
  • Do not use simple words such as "password" for your password

Alphanumeric characters (a-zA-Z0-9) and symbols ( =+*:;!|$&%#@~.,?_"&#'(){}[]<>^/\ ) can be used in passwords.

Please follow the procedure from the following URL to change your password.
https://accounts.pixiv.net/password/change

/hc/articles/115000679588-I-received-an-:
I received an e-mail notifying me "new pixiv login detected"

When a new login to services provided by pixiv or related services (BOOTH, pixiv COMIC, etc.) is detected, you will receive an e-mail notification at your registered e-mail address.

This e-mail will be sent to you under the following circumstances.

・When you log in for the first time on a new computer, smartphone, or browser.
・When you log in on a computer, smartphone, or browser that you haven't used to log in recently (notifications kick in after a set period of time).
・When you log in using a browser in Incognito, private, or secret mode.
・When you log in after erasing cookies and/or your browser history.

You can check your login history here:
https://accounts.pixiv.net/security-history

■ If you logged in yourself:
No problem. Please continue using pixiv as usual.

■ When you are notified of a login session that you were unaware of:
It is possible that a third party is impersonating you and fraudulently logging in to your account. For your own safety and security, please change your password via the link below.
https://accounts.pixiv.net/password/change

If you cannot change your password because you are unable to log in or for any other reason, please refer to this Help page to reset your password.

■ Please set a secure password
In order to use pixiv more securely, please use a password that you are not using for other sites and is difficult for a third party to guess easily.
For details, please check the Help page below.
How can I set up a secure password?

■ How can I make my account even more secure?
We recommend that you enable two-factor authentication.
Two-factor authentication is a method for increasing the security of your account. When you enable two-factor authentication, you will be required to use two separate inputs when you log in, which protects your account from unauthorized access.
Please check the following Help page to learn more.
What is two-factor authentication?

/hc/articles/235584348-Does-pixiv-take-m:
Does pixiv take measures against unauthorized access?

pixiv takes measures against unauthorized access to accounts on our services.

We take a multi-pronged approach to security. If we detect that a third party may have attempted to access an account without permission, we send an e-mail to the user. We also prevent the use of passwords that may be easily guessed by third parties, and take measures against cyberattacks that use software to generate multiple login attempts.

We also have a system where we notify our users via e-mail when there has been a new login to their account. This system enables immediate detection of fraudulent logins by third parties. To learn more, please check the Help page below.

・I received an e-mail notifying me "new pixiv login detected"

Cyberattack techniques are evolving by the day. We ask every member of our community to take their own personal measures to help prevent unauthorized logins, such as using safe, unique passwords that aren't shared with other services, and enabling two-factor authentication. To learn more, please check the following Help pages.

・How can I set up a secure password?
・What is two-factor authentication?

/hc/articles/235646967-What-are-Bookmark:
What are Bookmarks?

Bookmarks are a feature that allows you to easily look back on works you liked whenever you want.
You can make your Bookmarks public or private. The list of your Public Bookmarks can be viewed by others on your profile page. The list of your Private Bookmarks will not be displayed for others including the creator.

 

You can publically bookmark a work by pressing ♡ on the lower right of its work page.
The way to privately bookmark a work is as below.

 

<Desktop and Mobile>

At the bottom right of a work's page click or tap the ellipsis and select "♡privately".

 

<App>

Press and hold the heart icon in the lower right of the work's page, and a menu will be displayed. Toggle "Private" at the bottom of the menu, and then press "Save".

 

You can view works that you have bookmarked from the Bookmarks list.
By default, your public Bookmarks will be displayed. When browsing your private Bookmarks, you can swap between public and private with the buttons on the right of the page. Please click "Private" to view your private Bookmarks.

Bookmarks can be deleted or hidden for the following reasons.

  • The creator of the work changed the privacy settings to Private or My pixiv only
  • The creator deleted the work
  • The creator blocked you
  • You blocked the creator
  • The creator's account was deleted or suspended

Please refer to this page for how to edit your Bookmarks.

You can edit your bookmarks by doing the following.

■Desktop Version
■Mobile Version

■Desktop Version

When you want to edit each work individually.

  1. Access the Bookmarks page
  2. A "edit" button will appear when you hover over a work. Click on it to open the menu.
  3. On the menu you can select Edit tags to add or delete bookmark tags. If you select Set as private, you can set your bookmarks to private.

When you want to edit more than one work at the same time.

  1. Access the Bookmarks page
  2. On the menu you can select Edit tags to add or delete bookmark tags. If you select Set as private, you can set your bookmarks to private.
  3. You can select multiple works at once. Once selected, a blue checkmark should appear on the bottom right corner of the works.
  4. Once selected, you can use the buttons above to Create a tag, Set as private, and Remove bookmark in batches.

■Mobile Version

  1. Tap the heart mark underneath the work.
  2. Tap the ・・・button to open the menu.
  3. You can edit your bookmarks from that menu.

/hc/articles/235645207-What-is-Notificat:
What is Notification ?

Notification is a function used to notify users of new comments, tags or bookmarks on posted contents as well as new followers and My pixiv approvals in an easy, comprehensible manner.

Notifications are sent through the Notification at regular intervals when the contents are "bookmarked" or "liked".
If the type and contents for the notification are same, the old notifications are overwritten with new notifications so the pop-up will not be filled with duplicate notifications.

  • Notification Interval for Likes: For each item from 1 to 10, for every 10 items from 11 to 100, for every hundred items from 101 to 1,000, for every thousand items from 1,001 to 10,000 and for every ten thousand times when they exceed 10,000.
  • Bookmark Notification Interval: For each item from 1 to 10, for every 10 items from 11 to 100, for every hundred items from 101 to 1,000, for every thousand items from 1,001 to 10,000 and for every ten thousand times when they exceed 10,000.

/hc/articles/235644767-What-is-the-block:
What is the block feature in pixiv?

Block is a function to deny certain users from performing the following actions in regard to your own account.

  • Follow
  • Add to bookmarks
  • Add to 'My pixiv'
  • Send Message
  • Reply to Message
  • Send Illustrated Message
  • Send "Like!"
  • Edit Tag
  • Comment
  • Share
  • Respond to Image

* Associated My pixiv, Follows, Bookmarks, and Messages will also be removed if access is blocked. Messages sent and received by the users will be deleted. The same restrictions apply not just to the blocked user, but also the user who set up the block. Please keep this in mind.

On the desktop and smartphone browser versions, you can use this setting from the profile page of the account you'd like to mute.



You cannot block the viewing of profiles or contents.

When you follow someone privately, neither them nor other third parties will know you've followed them.

If you've already followed someone publicly, you can click or tap the ・・・ button to adjust your privacy settings.

/hc/articles/231286408-What-are-messages:
What are messages?

The messages function is a feature that allows you to send private messages to a user you designate in a format similar to e-mail.
Unlike the comments on content, no one other than the sender and the recipient can view the messages they share.

You can use messages to send .jpg, .png, and .gif files that are up to 8 MB in size.
You can send messages that contain up to 10,000 characters. 

You can send messages using the message icon on a user's profile page.

*The message icon is not displayed on your own profile page, or on the profile pages of users who have set their message settings to "Only pixiv verified accounts".

How do I change my settings so I don't receive messages?

Go to your message settings and select "Only pixiv verified accounts", under "Who can message you" to stop receiving new messages from other users.

See below for details on what happens when you change your message settings to "Only pixiv verified accounts".

  • If you change your message settings to "Only pixiv verified accounts", you will only receive new messages from pixiv verified Accounts.

    Learn more about pixiv verified Accounts

  • You will still receive messages from people you are already in contact with, even if you change your settings to "Only pixiv verified accounts".

    • If you do not wish to receive any further messages from people you are already in contact with, you can use the block feature.

      *Using the block feature will delete all your previous correspondence with the people you blocked, so consider carefully before using this feature.

      Learn more about the block feature

  • You will receive notifications of My pixiv requests regardless of your message settings. However, if you change your settings to "Only pixiv verified accounts", you will not receive any messages attached to My pixiv requests.

    Learn more about My pixiv

  • If you change your message settings to "Only pixiv verified accounts", the message icon will not be displayed to other people browsing your profile page.

    *The message icon will not be displayed on your own profile section when you visit it, regardless of whether you changed your settings to "Only pixiv verified accounts".

  • If you want to join pixiv COMIC Indies and receive messages from or get scouted by editors, please choose the "All accounts" setting.

    • Indies editor accounts are not pixiv verified Accounts.

      Learn more about pixiv COMIC Indies

See below for info on how to change your message settings.

▶︎Desktop

Desktop

  • Click on the message icon in the header, or on your user icon, and select "Settings".

  • You can also jump from "Message settings" on the Messages page.

  • On the Message settings page, go to ”Who can message you" and select "Only pixiv verified accounts".

Mobile

  • Select "Settings" from the left header menu.

  • On the Settings page, select ”Who can message you".

  • On the Message settings page, go to ”Who can message you" and select "Only pixiv verified accounts".

/hc/articles/231286908-What-is-Rankings:
What is Rankings?

Ranking is a tally of the content rankings that includes any content posted publicly to pixiv.
"pixiv rank β", a ranking algorithm unique to pixiv, totals the number of factors, such as views and "likes!", received each day between 0:00 to 23:59:59, and then determines the rankings. The tally results are applied every day at 12:00 noon.

/hc/articles/230700147-What-types-of-ran:
What types of rankings are there available?

The following rankings are available. Every afternoon we release the rankings based on the totals calculated up to and including the previous day.

  • Daily: the totals for each day.
  • Weekly: Total for each week.
  • Monthly: Total for each month.
  • Rookie: Rankings that focus on users who have never been included in the daily rankings before.
  • Original: Ranking of original contents that are not included in fan art.
  • AI-generated: Rankings including only AI-generated work.
  • R-18: The ranking of content with R-18 browsing settings.
  • R-18G: the ranking of content with R-18G browsing settings.

Items posted in the daily rankings once will never be posted in the Rookie Rankings thereafter.

AI-generated work is exclusively featured in AI-generated work-only rankings.
