/hc/articles/360002987773-What-are-the-r:
What are the rules regarding translations?

Rules about translating tags.
Currently, we're only accepting translation suggestions for Japanese tags.

About translating to English

About spaces and parentheses

  • You can use spaces in your suggested translations
    Example: When translating the Japanese tag for "black hair", please use the wording "black hair" by separating each word with a space.
  • Please avoid parentheses whenever possible
    If parentheses are not used in the original tags, please do not use parentheses in your suggested translation.
    For example, if parentheses are not used in the official translation of a character name, please do not include them in your suggested translation (you don't need to add the anime/manga title in parentheses. Translations might be ambiguous without adding the work title in parentheses, but please do not include it nevertheless.
    If the original tag includes parentheses, you are allowed to use them in your suggested translation.

 

About the order of first names and last names

  • When suggesting a translation, please follow the order "Name - Last Name".
    Example: even if the Japanese notation follows the order "Last Name - Name", please follow the order "Name - Last Name" when suggesting a translation.

 

About upper case and lower case letters

  • Please use capital letters for the first letter of titles and character names. Try to stick to the official notation as much as possible.
    Example of character names/person names in English
    ・田中一郎 → Ichiro Tanaka
  • Please enter everything else (such as ordinary nouns) in lowercase letters.
    Example: Please suggest "illustration" instead of "Illustration".

 

About mixing translated names and Japanese transliterations

  • Sometimes, translated names and Japanese transliterations are used together.
    When the official work (manga/anime etc.) name includes both an English title and a Japanese transliteration, please input both when suggesting your translation.

About translating to Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese and Korean

About spaces and parentheses

  • You can use spaces in your suggested translations
  • Please avoid parentheses whenever possible
    If parentheses are not used in the original tags, please do not use parentheses in your suggested translation.
    For example, if parentheses are not used in the official translation of a character name, please do not include them in your suggested translation (you don't need to add the anime/manga title in parentheses. Translations might be ambiguous without adding the work title in parentheses, but please do not include it nevertheless.
    If the original tag includes parentheses, you are allowed to use them in your suggested translation.

About work titles and character names

When suggesting translations for work titles and character names, make sure to use the official notation.

About the order of first names and last names

Please follow the order "Name - Last Name".
Example: even if the Japanese notation follows the order "Last Name - Name", please follow the order "Name - Last Name" when suggesting a translation.

About mixing English and other languages

Sometimes, English and other languages are used together.
When the official work name includes both English and other languages, please follow the official notation when suggesting your translation.
Example:
pixivイラストコンテスト → pixiv插画大赛
pixivイラストコンテスト → pixiv插畫大賽
pixivイラストコンテスト → pixiv일러스트 콘테스트

/hc/articles/8862096131353-What-sort-of-:
What sort of information will be deleted and what sort of information will remain when the account linking with Tumeng is removed?

Account linking with Tumeng will end on September 12th, 2022.

The following information will be deleted at that time.

If you are linking your account

  • Information to be deleted from Tumeng
    • User ID (The digits that appear at the end of the URL on the profile page)
    • Nickname and introduction
    • Profile image
  • Information to be deleted from pixiv
    • Number of followers that came from your account on Tumeng

If you have a Tumeng-specific profile

  • The following information will be deleted from both Tumeng and pixiv
    • The nickname and introduction in your Tumeng profile
    • The profile image in your Tumeng profile

If you are sharing works on Tumeng

  • Information to be deleted from Tumeng
    • User ID (The digits that appear at the end of the URL on the profile page)
    • Works’ images, titles, descriptions, and tags
    • Works’ number of comments, bookmarks, and likes
  • Information to be deleted from pixiv
    • The number of likes, comments, and bookmarks received on Tumeng

No information that was shared with Tumeng will remain on Tumeng.

The deleted information will be limited to the information shared with Tumeng. Accounts that are linked with pixiv or works posted to pixiv will not have the data of any interactions that occurred on pixiv deleted. The only information that will be deleted from pixiv is limited to what is listed above.

/hc/articles/235571407-How-do-I-show-gro:
How do I show groups to my friends?

You can tell your friends about a group by doing the following:

1. Open/Closed Groups

If you're the group's admin
Press "Add group member", displayed on the right side of the group page.
You can send the "Invitation URL" via messages to invite members.
If you're not the admin
You can just tell them the group page's URL.
When they click "Join", they'll be able to join the group.
* If joining the group requires Admin approval, they'll be able to join once approved by an admin.

2. Secret Groups

Only the Admin can add people to a secret group.
Press "Add group member", displayed on the right side of the group page.
You can send the "Invitation URL" via messages to invite members to bring them to the group page.

* Underage users and those with browsing restrictions cannot join R-18 groups.

/hc/articles/235571287-How-should-I-beha:
How should I behave within a group? What isn't permitted?

Groups are a way to exchange ideas with other users. Please use general internet manners.

Slander is prohibited
Groups are a way to foster communication about works via comments.
As such, please try to keep the space enjoyable for all group members.
Multiple posts are prohibited
Posting the same content multiple times, in multiple groups for the purpose of promoting your work is prohibited.
Gibberish comments and spamming posts are prohibited on account of being bothersome
Avoid actions that may be annoying or irritating to other users.
Posts that go against group policy
Each group has its own theme and rules that must be followed.
When the rules of a group you've joined are clearly written and defined, please follow them.

When there's trouble within a group, please try to find a resolution with the parties involved.

Additionally, groups must be in line with pixiv's Guidelines and Terms of Use. If you discover that someone is in violation of these, please use the report feature within your group.

/hc/articles/231497188-One-of-my-works-h:
One of my works has been republished on pixiv without my permission

Persons who upload content to pixiv need to hold the copyright of their own content, or they must have obtained permission from the copyright holder to post the content. pixiv prohibits the unauthorized republishing of works and the unauthorized manipulation and submission of works. If any of the following activities are reported, the offending account will be canceled.

  • Activities in which content submitted to pixiv and works posted to third-party websites is republished without permission.
  • Activities in which screenshots and other images of trademarked content, such as official characters, are manipulated and submitted to pixiv.
  • The unauthorized use of works as profile graphics, on novel covers, or other such uses.

If you confirm that your work is being used without your permission, please contact pixiv with the following information through the inquiry form:

  • The title and full URL of the content that you believe to be in violation of your copyright.
  • An explanation of how your copyright is being violation.
    (Example: The illustration/graphic has been republished without authorization, and the content as a whole is a copy of my original content or something similar to this.)
  • For the work, of which you hold a copyright, and for which you believe your copyright has been violated, here is a type of content (Example: illustrations, manga cartoons, novel, or other content) and the details thereof (Example: the title, publisher, date published, URL, or other particulars).
  • Your contact information (such as an e-mail address)

/hc/articles/231497448-One-of-my-works-h:
One of my works has been republished on a third-party website without my permission.

To have your work deleted by the company that manages the service where your illustration has been republished, you will need to contact the service and state to them that you are the author of the work.

If your illustration has been republished on a third-party website, we ask that users send a statement to the operator/customer support department of the corresponding website proving that you are the author of your content. If your illustration is not deleted after this, please contact pixiv again.
The operators of pixiv will also provide support in proving your claim to have the offending work deleted.

Because our company’s position in making a request to have your work deleted is only that of a third party and may not be very effective, we ask for your understanding in underlining the need for a statement from you the author.

If the original content no longer exists, it may not be possible to take action. Therefore, gather as much proof as possible that the offending content is yours, and then send your statement to the website operator.

If your content has been republished on a website that operates outside Japan, refer to the template below, and request that your content be deleted.

______________________________________________________________________
Hello,

I would like to inform you that your website contains my works that are reposted without consent.
I'm sorry, but can you please take my works off your website as soon as possible?
I'm sorry for any inconvenience it may have caused you. Thank you very much.

Name: 
Mail: 
Corresponding URL: (URL where content is being posted)
Original Source and URL: (URL where you originally posted your content)
______________________________________________________________________

/hc/articles/4406210592921-You-may-not-b:
You may not be able to leave pixiv if you are currently using FANBOX, BOOTH, or pixiv Sketch

There are cases in which you may be unable to leave pixiv depending on the status of pixiv's linked services.

 

■ If you are registered with BOOTH

 

Log in to the BOOTH account that is linked with the pixiv account you want to leave pixiv with. Go to "Account settings" and then click "Delete account" to start the procedures for leaving. Once your BOOTH account has been deleted, you will be unable to use any features that require a login. You will not be able to use the same e-mail address to re-register or re-open your account.

 

If you've established a Shop, please refer to this FAQ.

 

If you have any questions about leaving BOOTH, please feel free to fill out the Contact Us form. Once you've finished deleting your BOOTH account, you'll be able to continue the procedures for leaving pixiv.

 

■ If you are registered with FANBOX

 

If you have a remaining pledge balance on FANBOX or are within 1 month of applying for a deposit to your Japanese bank account, you will be unable to leave.

Once you have accepted any remaining balance on FANBOX, and once over a month has passed since you applied for a deposit to your Japanese bank account, you will be able to continue the procedures for leaving pixiv.

 

It is not possible for accounts registered as creators on FANBOX to leave pixiv. You can stop being registered as a creator by going here, and then you will be able to continue the procedures for leaving pixiv. Please refer to this FAQ if you have more questions.

 

You will not be able to leave pixiv if you're supporting a creator on FANBOX. You can stop your pledges on FANBOX via the following procedures.

 

From the menu for "Supported Creators", please select "Change Plan" for the creator(s) you'd like to stop supporting. Then select "Update payment method".

 

Select "Stop being a FAN" at the bottom of the page.

 

Please note that even if you leave during the middle of the month, it will still cost the same 1 month's pledge. Your pledge will not be calculated by the day.

If you opted to pay via the convenience store method, and you pay the following month, your payment will not be adjusted to your situation nor will you be refunded.

 

For more details, please refer to this FAQ.

Once you've stopped your support on FANBOX, you will be able to continue leaving pixiv.

 

■ If you still have unclaimed rewards in pixiv Sketch

In order to waive your rewards, you need to leave pixiv Sketch. Please contact pixiv Sketch using the inquiry form, and include the following three pieces of information:

1. The e-mail address you have registered with pixiv
2. Your account name
3. The reason you're contacting us: Request to waive rewards / leave pixiv Sketch

/hc/articles/900002679206-Request-flow:
Request flow

  1. The creator creates the terms for their requests.
  2. Fans send in their requests.
  3. The creator receives the request.
  4. The creator accepts the request.
  5. Other fans co-request the work.
  6. The creator posts the work
  7. The request is reviewed
  8. Fans receive the finished work
  9. Profits are transferred (paid) to the creator


① The creator creates the terms for their requests.

  • This is only required once.
  • The creation of request terms is required to open requests.
  • Request terms are the conditions under which you are opening your requests.
  • You can create terms ad open your requests from the Manage Requests page.

(Where to find the Manage Requests menu)

Related Help articles

  • How do I manage requests?
  • What happens when I open my requests?
  • How do I set a realistic target price?
  • Do I have to take on all the requests I receive?
  • Can I edit my request terms?
  • Can I make multiple sets of Terms?
  • Can I stop accepting requests?

 

Pending approval

② Fans send in their requests.

  • If you find a creator you would like to send a request to, check their request terms, decide on the content you want and price, then send the request
  • You can check the open request terms in the "Requests" tab on the creator's profile page

(Profile page)

 

  • You can go to a creator's profile by clicking the "Accepting requests" badge by their name, or clicking on the "Send a request" button on any of their works' details page.

(Work page)

 

  • When sending a request, fill in the details and payment amount on the Send request page, then click the "Confirm details" button to continue to the payment information page.

(Send request page)

 

  • A list of all the requests you have sent can be found on the Manage Requests page.

(Where to find the Manage Requests menu)

Related Help articles

  • What should I write in my request?
  • How should I decide the amount to offer for a request?
  • Can I cancel a sent request?
  • What payment methods can I use?
  • What happens if the creator doesn't accept a request and the response deadline passes?
  • I'd like to have an in-depth discussion about a request. Can I use the pixiv Message feature to communicate?

 

③ The creator receives the request.

  • When you receive a request from a fan, you will be notified by message, notification or e-mail.
  • You can decide which requests you wish to take on upon considering the content, the price offered, and your schedule.
  • You have 7 days to decide whether or not to accept the requests you receive.
  • A list of all the requests you have received can be found on the Manage Requests page.

Related Help articles

  • Do I have to take on all the requests I receive?
  • What happens if I exceed the response deadline of a request?
  • What happens if I decline a request from a fan?

 

In-progress

④ The creator accepts the request.

  • Once you decide that you wish to take on a request, you can accept it.
  • When accepting a request, you can choose to make it public or private. If you accept a request publicly, other fans can co-request it. Please visit this page for more details.
  • You have 60 days from the day you receive the request to complete it. You should finish the work before the deadline.

Related Help articles

  • Can I cancel a request that is already in progress?
  • How do I hide the price of a request from other users?
  • What are public and private requests?

 

⑤ Other fans co-request the work.

  • Public, in-progress requests can be co-requested by other fans, offering the same amount to the creator. Co-requesting a work is a way to show that you also like the content of that request.
  • Creators can stop soliciting co-requests by making requests private even while they are already in progress. Only the creator can change the privacy settings for a request.

(Where to change privacy settings)

Related Help articles

  • What are co-requests?
  • What should I do if someone co-requests a work?

 

⑥ The creator posts the work

  • When the requested work is completed, the creator posts it on pixiv. You should post your work from the button at the bottom of the Request page. Other users will be able to see the work immediately after it is posted according to its privacy settings.
  • Unlike normal work submissions, there are two choices of privacy settings for requested works: "public" and "URL restricted". If you want your work to be only visible to the fans who requested and co-requested it, please set the work as URL restricted.
  • Additionally, creators can use the gift file feature to send fans a different file than the one they completed by request. Gift files can only be received by the fans who requested and co-requested a work. See this page for more details.
  • Those involved in the request will not receive a notification at this stage.

Related Help articles

  • What's the difference between a requested work and normal works?
  • What is URL restriction?
  • Do I have to post my work on pixiv?
  • What are gift files?

 

⑦ The request is reviewed

  • Submitting a requested work does not mean that the request is complete, as the work will be reviewed first.
  • While your work is reviewed, we need to confirm that it does not abuse the Requests feature and check for fraudulent payments. If we find any issues with your work during this stage, you may be asked for revisions.
  • If you get a revision request and you've already posted a gift file, it will be made private. Please check to see if the content follows our Guidelines and Terms before trying to post it again.

Related Help articles

  • What does it mean when a request is in review?
  • Can I replace a work that is in review?


Request complete

⑧ Fans receive the completed request.

  • Once your request has been reviewed, it is considered complete. The creator's profits will be set and further refunds will not generally occur.
  • At this stage, all users involved in the request will receive notification and e-mail when the request is complete.
  • Once the request is complete, please refrain from communicating directly with fans or the creator about revisions or redos of the work.
  • Fans are invited to send in a new request after the request is complete if they wish for revisions. We do not recommend accepting revision requests with the Requests feature.
  • Fans who have requested or co-requested a work can now give their thoughts to creators using the Fan Letter feature.
  • Completed works that you've requested or co-requested are now displayed in the "Requested works" tab on your profile page.
  • Works requested anonymously, are set to private, or are URL-restricted will not be displayed to other users.

Related Help articles

  • What happens to the rights of requested works?
  • Is it possible to redo a requested work?
  • How should I handle revision requests?
  • What kind of feature is Fan Letters?


⑨ Profits are transferred (paid) to the creator

  • The set profits will be transferred in the manner specified by the creator and the request will be fully completed. Good work!
  • You can view the amount to be transferred and your transfer history on the Money Management page.

(Where to find the Money Management menu)

  • What are the available transfer methods for profits?
  • How much money will I actually receive?

/hc/articles/900004161046-The-process-fo:
The process for resending requests

About resending request offers

Creators can ask that fans resend a canceled request with the same content, or a similar request with some changes.

 

  1. The creator sends a resend offer to the fan
  2. The fan receives the offer to resend the request
  3. The fan resends the request
  4. The creator receives the request
  5. The creator accepts the request

 

① The creator sends a resend offer to the fan

From the request details page, creators can invite a fan to resend their request.

Creators can offer to resend a request only once per request. Creators cannot take back an offer to resend a request.

 

If a creator thinks that the work type or age restrictions don't fit with the content of a request they received, they can invite the fan to change the conditions for the request. For more information on age restrictions, please check the pixiv Guidelines.

*Creators cannot change the content or the price of the request.

*Creators cannot select a type of work that isn't enabled under their original terms.

*If a creator only accepts all-ages requests under their original terms, they cannot invite the fan to change the age restrictions to R-18 or R-18G.

*Depending on the location of residence of the fan who sent the request, creators may not be able to invite the fan to change the age restrictions to R-18 or R-18G.

*Creators cannot invite a fan to change the request conditions for a request that has already passed its submission deadline.

 

② The fan receives the offer to resend the request

When the fan receives the offer to resend the request, they will be notified via messages or notifications. If you would like to resend the request, please confirm and resend it within seven days.

The fan can resend a request from the request details page. If the creator has asked them to change the request conditions, the content of the changes will also be displayed.

*Fans cannot change the content or price of the request. If one would like to change either of these parameters, they can send a separate request.

 

③ The fan resends the request

Fans can change the payment method when they resend a request.

 

④ The creator receives the request

When the creator receives a re-sent request from a fan, the creator must accept or decline the request within seven days, as for a normal request.

 

⑤ The creator accepts the request

If the creator accepts the request, as for a normal request, the deadline is 60 days from the date the request was sent. Creators must complete the request by the deadline.

Can I set a cover image for my Request terms?

You can select a cover image for your terms on the desktop and mobile versions of pixiv.

You can decorate your Request terms with an image by selecting a cover image.
You can pick something for the enjoyment of fans going to look at your terms or use it to communicate with your fans.
Furthermore, remember that any important things you want your fans to know can and should be conveyed through a written description in the terms details section.

You can upload a terms cover image by clicking the pencil icon on the upper part of the page with your terms' details.
You can upload a JPEG / PNG/ GIF that is under 8MB. Recommended aspect ratio is 2:1.
You also cannot upload an image that is R-18, R-18G, or violates any of our Guidelines.
We will switch any inappropriate image to private.
Your cover image might also not be displayed depending on the other conditions or location.

/hc/articles/19617618729113-What-does-it:
What does it mean if a request is labeled as "being processed"?

When a creator accepts a request, the request is temporarily listed as "being processed".

During this processing phase, pixiv will bill the requesting fan. The status of the request will change to "in progress" as soon as the billing goes through successfully.

 

Though it normally takes a few minutes for a request acceptance to be processed, if the fan's payment method requires reconfirmation by pixiv, or if an error occurs either in the pixiv servers or in the servers of the third-party payment service, this process may take up to a few days to complete.

 

All requests in the "being processed" phase cannot be canceled by the requesting fan or due to expiration of the response deadline.

/hc/articles/12962026901401-What-items-a:
What items and transactions are prohibited under the Terms of Use?

On this service, we recognize that we have a responsibility to society, so in order to safely and smoothly operate our service, we have set standards for items and transactions based on consideration for laws, ordinances, public order and decency, and other factors.

"Items and transactions" are requests sent by fans to creators, and works posted by creators in response to requests.

The standards will be posted in pixiv's Service Master Terms of Use, Article 14, Item 28 "Using the Services to display, sell, purchase, register, or engage in other transactions involving the products set forth below".

However, pixiv's judgments may be subject to change depending on changes in societal environments or expectations. This update may not be permanent. Thank you for your understanding and cooperation.

For practical purposes, prohibited items and transactions are divided into the following two categories.

  • Prohibited Items
  • Items Requiring Revision

 

*The content of this page, as well as the standards and actions regarding "Prohibited Items" and "Items Requiring Revision" apply from Thursday, December 15th, 2022, based on the updated Terms of Use, which goes into effect on that date.

/hc/articles/12962271633689-What-are-Pro:
What are Prohibited Items?

”Prohibited Items" are items prohibited under the Terms of Use, Article 14, Item 28, No. 4.

In particular, they include items that contain the following live-action elements that violate public order and standards of decency.

They also include items with the following content that violate public order and standards of decency due to being so highly realistic as to create concerns about whether their creation may have involved the victimization of living people.

*The following are just examples, and may be subject to change in the future.

*Some items which do not contain such content may also be deemed Prohibited Items.

”Prohibited Items" are items that meet the following two conditions.

  1. Types of work (examples)
    • Live action
    • Photo-realistic work that could be mistaken for live action
    • Works that cause concerns about whether their creation may have involved the victimization of living people or animals
  2. Work content (examples)
    • Sexual exploitation or sexual abuse of a minor (*1)
    • Incest
    • Bestiality
    • Rape (or any other non-consensual sexual behavior)
    • Non-consensual mutilation of a person or body part
    • Any other content deemed inappropriate by pixiv

Scope of applicable items and content

  • Specified transactions (Requests)
  • Items exchanged in financial transactions
  • Content (profiles, icons, cover images, sets of terms, etc.) displayed to solicit or promote transactions on an account used for transactions.

Handling of violations

If we discover such items or content on our services, we may take the following actions.

  • Cancel the request, or set it to private
  • Deleting the items/content or setting them permanently to Private
  • Account suspension
  • Prohibition or limitation on the use of specified transactions

*1　"Minor" is defined based on the definition set forth in the Act on Regulation and Punishment of Acts Relating to Child Prostitution and Child Pornography, and the Protection of Children

*The content of this article, as well as the standards and actions regarding "Prohibited Items" and "Items Requiring Revision" apply from Thursday, December 15th, 2022, based on the updated Terms of Use, which goes into effect on that date.

/hc/articles/12962355638553-What-are-Ite:
What are Items Requiring Revision?

"Items Requiring Revision" are items, including images and data, which are prohibited under the Terms of Use, Article 14, Item 28, No. 4, and which are deemed by pixiv to be in possible violation of laws, ordinances, public order and decency, and pixiv's Terms of Use.

In particular, they include items that are not live-action or highly realistic, but whose content or accompanying data (titles, tags, post captions, or other item descriptions) have been deemed to require revision.

*These are just examples, and may be subject to change in the future.

Items requiring revision will be judged holistically based on work content and accompanying data.

  • Accompanying data (examples)
    • Titles
    • Tags
    • Post captions
    • Other descriptions
  • Work content (examples)
    • Sexual exploitation or sexual abuse of a minor (*1)
    • Incest
    • Bestiality
    • Rape (or any other non-consensual sexual behavior)
    • Non-consensual mutilation of a person or body part
    • Any other content deemed inappropriate by pixiv

Scope of applicable items and content

  • Specified transactions (Requests)
  • Items exchanged in financial transactions
  • Content (profiles, icons, cover images, sets of terms, etc.) displayed to solicit or promote transactions on an account used for transactions.

Handling of violations

If we discover such items or content on our services, we may take the following actions.

  • Request temporarily set to private. Please revise your request.
    • If the revision causes the item to no longer be in violation of regulations, you can re-send it.
  • Temporarily setting the items to Private, and requesting revision.
    • If the revision causes the item to no longer be in violation of regulations, you can re-post it.
  • Users who post large volumes of items that clearly require revision, or repeatedly ignore requests for revision, and who pixiv deems to be deliberately malicious, may be subject to the following actions.
    • Items deleted or set permanently to Private
    • Account suspension
    • Prohibition or limitation on the use of specified transactions

*1　"Minor" is defined based on the definition set forth in the Act on Regulation and Punishment of Acts Relating to Child Prostitution and Child Pornography, and the Protection of Children

*The content of this article, as well as the standards and actions regarding "Prohibited Items" and "Items Requiring Revision" apply from Thursday, December 15th, 2022, based on the updated Terms of Use, which goes into effect on that date.

Both the creator and fans will not be penalized when the creator does not accept a request.
Feel free to choose which requests to take on.

/hc/articles/900002294123-When-will-I-re:
When will I receive my profits?

Profits from requests posted between the 1st to the end of each month will be processed within 5 business days (excluding weekends and bank holidays) from the 20th of the following month.
* Depending on your bank, it may take a few days for the funds to show up in your account

The date of your initial request post will determine the payment month, even if it is still processing after the month has ended.
However, please do not submit incomplete works in order to expedite the month in which your payment will be made. Be aware that such behavior is considered misconduct and we may take action, such as suspending your account.

For profits of less than 5,000 JPY, you can either request a transfer from your Money management page, or the profits will be automatically transferred into your account in the month prior to 180 days from the date you received the request.

/hc/articles/900002871823-What-fees-will:
What fees will be deducted from my profits?

Fees deducted from your profits are divided into two types: "platform fees" and "transfer fees".

 

Platform fees

10% of your profits

 

Transfer fees

■ Bank transfer

Fees differ depending on the amount of money you are transferring.

  • Transfer of 30,000 JPY or more ⇒ 300 JPY
  • Transfer of less than 30,000 ⇒ 200 JPY

■ PayPal

No transfer fees apply.
However, a currency conversion fee will apply if you need to convert JPY to a different currency when transferring your profits.

■ Wise

Fees are determined based on Wise's fee structure. For details, please check the Help section on the Wise official website.

https://wise.com/help/articles/2522717

/hc/articles/4415135774745-Is-it-possibl:
Is it possible to use payment services like Payoneer or WorldFirst?

Some people use payment-receiving services (such as Payoneer or WorldFirst) to receive payments, rather than their own personal bank accounts, but we strongly advise against using these kinds of services.

This is because these services may, at their own discretion, reject the payments we are transferring into your account. In such a case, we will accept inquiries and work to redo the payment, but please note that a fee may apply.

We invite you to choose one of the available payout methods when setting up your transfer account.

We will continue exploring ways to collaborate with payment-receiving services and find solutions to the situation.

/hc/articles/13761627218841-What-is-AI-g:
What is AI-generated work Request terms?

If the terms details page says "AI-generated work is posted under these terms", then all requests posted under those terms will be marked as AI-generated work.

 

Requests sent to terms for AI-generated work will have the label "AI-generated" displayed on the request details page.

 

The label "AI-generated" will appear on request-related pages, including the Requests overview page.

 

When you submit a request, if the terms details page does not say "AI-generated work is posted under these terms", then no requests posted under those terms will be AI-generated work.

Also, if the label "AI-generated" does not appear on the Requests overview page or on the request details page, then no AI-generated work will be posted under those terms.

/hc/articles/900001640046-What-should-I-:
What should I write in my request?

Tell the creator honestly and concisely about the piece you want, including what you will use the requested material for.
Please refrain from specifying a deadline in your message, since deadlines are already set by the system.

Please note that you cannot change the amount of money you offer or the content of the message after sending your request.
Also, you can not give instructions to the creator after your request has been sent, so please collect all your thoughts in the request description.

*Tags help convey more to the creator about the type of work you're requesting.
Please write the details of the type of work you're requesting in the "Request details" field.

*If you post links to reference materials in the content of your request, you must ensure that the content is easily interpreted by a third party and makes the general content of your request clear.

/hc/articles/10242320598681-A-beginner-s:
A beginner's guide

What is SUPER pixivEMOOoji Month?

SUPER pixivEMOOOji Month is a special month giving you the possibility to support creators by attaching emojis to work posted on pixiv.

The event will go from Tuesday, September 20th to Monday, October 24th, 2022 11:59 am JST.

 

Attach an emoji

① Click "" on the work page
② Select an emoji
③ The emojis will appear in the order they were attached

 

Each work can have up to 100 different kinds of emojis attached.

 

Check the person who attached the emoji

You can see who attached an emoji by clicking "" on the work page.

 

Remove emojis you attached by mistake

① Click "" on the work page
② Select the emoji you attached that you want to remove
③ Click "Take back"

 

Create original emojis

① Click "" on the work page
② Click "Create emoji" to be taken to the dedicated page
③ Scroll down to see "Create emoji" displayed

 

Text

With SUPER pixivEMOOOji Month, you can create emojis by entering text. The text might get cut off depending on the size and length of the message.

 

Freehand Drawing

With SUPER pixivEMOOOji Month, you can create emojis drawing an illustration. You can create an original emoji even without any illustration software.

 

 

Image Upload

You can register your illustration as emoji if the file format is JPEG, PNG, or GIF. You cannot register images of real life such as photographs.
*Registering anime and game screenshots or the work of other people is prohibited.

 

④Give your emoji a name so you can search it later.

 

Search emoji and attach them to posts

You can use emojis created by other people too.
① Click "" on the work page
② Enter the emoji's name in the search bar
③ Select the emoji you want to attach to the work

 

To creators: Hiding emoji

You can hide emojis from all of your work. You cannot hide them on a work-by-work basis.
① Click "Emoji Settings" from the page of a work you created
② Click "Turn emojis OFF"

 

For more details

There is a FAQ page with articles explaining further details and guidelines for you to know when attaching emojis. Please use them if you're having trouble.

 

Artwork by 寺田てら（user/2764844）

/hc/articles/10478412759961-How-can-I-ma:
How can I make it so that emojis cannot be attached to my work?

You can turn emojis off in the settings if you don't want to receive them.
Click on Emoji Settings displayed on the lower right portion of a work's page and click "Turn emojis OFF".
You will no longer be able to receive emojis, and all emojis you have received until then will be hidden.
 
*This will apply to all of your work. You cannot turn emojis off on a work-by-work basis.
*The setting in ON by default.

Artwork by 寺田てら（user/2764844）

 

If you changed your emoji settings to off, all emojis previously attached to your work will be hidden. They will no longer be hidden if you choose to turn emojis back on.

After you've removed an emoji, no one will be able to attach it again.

/hc/articles/10519268883865-Why-was-an-e:
Why was an emoji attached to my work removed?

Consider the following if an emoji attached to your work was removed.

  • It was in violation of the Guidelines.
    Emojis that violate any guidelines listed in "Prohibited conduct and emojis that cannot be attached to works" will be made private by the management team.
    *In this case, the emoji would also be made private from "Created Emojis".
  • The person who attached the emoji removed it.
  • You accidentally removed the emoji.

Additionally, all emojis will no longer be displayed after the end of "SUPER pixivEMOOOji Month". (Monday, October 24th, 2022 11:59 am JST)

How do I attach emojis?

You can attach emoji by doing the following.
① Open the page for the work you want to attach an emoji to, and click on "".
② Select the emoji you want to attach.
③ Check that the emoji you attached is displayed on the work page.

Artwork by 寺田てら（user/2764844）

 

If you want to add an already attached emoji
When you click the emoji displayed at the bottom of the illustration, the number to the right of the emoji will increase, and you will have attached the same emoji.

 

Notes
・You cannot attach emojis to URL-restricted work that has been posted through the Requests feature.
・Only 100 different kinds of emojis can be attached to a single post.
・The username of the person who attached the emoji will be displayed on the emoji viewer.
・Emojis will be displayed in the order that they were attached to the post.
You can display all emojis attached to a post by clicking "●● more".

How can I make new emojis?

 ① Click on "" on the work page.
 ② By clicking the button at the bottom of the page, you will be sent to the "SUPER pixivEMOOOji Month" dedicated page.
 ③ Scroll down to "Create emoji" and click either "Text", "Freehand Drawing", or "Image Upload" and follow the instructions on the page to create your emoji. After registering a name to your emoji, you can attach it to works.

*Use the emoji's name when searching it. We recommend you register an appropriate name that will make it easy for you to find it.

Artwork by  寺田てら（user/2764844）
 
【テキストでつくる】
SUPER pixivEMOOOji Monthの機能上でテキストを入力すれば思いをメッセージにした絵文字が作れます。絵文字の表示サイズ上、長文だと文字が潰れて表示される場合があります。
 
【手描きでつくる】
SUPER pixivEMOOOji Monthの機能上でイラストを描くことができ、ペイントソフトがなくてもオリジナルの絵文字を作れます。
 
【画像でつくる】
使い慣れたツールで描いたお手元のイラストをJPEG、PNG、GIF、いずれかの画像に変換すれば絵文字として登録できます。写真など実写の画像は登録できません。
※アニメやゲームのスクリーンショット、他人のイラストの登録は禁止行為になります。
